title: Fix admin page form submission by ensuring actor initialization does not fail when access control is already initialized

requirements.text:
Fix the admin-page form submission error that says the form is not connected to the backend by ensuring the frontend actor initialization does not fail when calling the existing backend access-control initialization method.

Specifically, update the actor creation flow so that if `initializeAccessControl()` (or `_initializeAccessControlWithSecret(...)` when present) throws because access control is already initialized, the error is handled and the actor is still returned/usable. Do not change any backend code or backend interface/structure.

quotes: Proveď pouze jednu konkrétní úpravu: oprav odesílání formuláře na admin stránku, protože aktuálně hlásí, že není propojeno s backendem.
Zajisti správné napojení formuláře na existující backend bez změny jeho struktury.

acceptanceCriteria: From /admin (after Internet Identity login), submitting the form successfully calls the existing backend `createForm` method and shows the existing success behavior instead of any "not connected to backend" error.

If the backend returns an error indicating access control is already initialized, the frontend does not treat this as a fatal actor-creation error; the actor is still created and queries/mutations can proceed.
No unrelated frontend refactors, redesigns, style/layout changes, or file structure changes are made; only the minimal code change necessary to restore admin-page form submission is included.

constraints: Use version 151 as the only baseline; do not apply or port any changes from versions 152–170.
Do not change backend structure, types, or endpoints; connect to the existing backend as-is.
Do not refactor, redesign, optimize, change layout/styles, or restructure files; modify only code strictly necessary to fix the admin form submission.
nonGoals: Adding new features or UI improvements.
Changing authentication flows beyond what is strictly needed to restore backend connectivity for form submission.
Modifying validation rules or form fields.
Any backend logic or schema changes.
